title: Capturing @ in a non-Send ~fn causes memory_region to crash

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
``` rust
fn main() {
    fn f(_: ~fn:()) {} // note `fn:` overrides the default `fn:Send`.
    fn eat<T>(_: T) {}

    let x = @1;
    f(|| eat(x));
}
```

It doesn't fail with e.g. `x = 1` or `x = &1`.

```
leaked memory in rust main loop (1 objects)
```
